source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_021_chunk1
evidence_span: The basis for this model is that PCI fracture of LWR fuel rods is caused by stress corrosion cracking (SCC), with the fission-product iodine being the responsible chemical species.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_021_chunk1
evidence_span: The characteristics of the fracture surfaces examined in both BWR and PWR fuel rods are typical of SCC fractures produced in laboratory iodine SCC tests

evidence_span: The characteristics of the fracture surfaces examined in both BWR and PWR fuel rods are typical of SCC fractures produced in laboratory iodine SCC tests
